{{Koninklijke Bibliotheek}} 001_voorplat-achterplat Front and back side of late 16th-century (1590-1600) brown leather binding with Caritas blocks and decorative rolls in gold https://www.kb.nl/kbhtml/bout/001_voorplat-achterplat.jpg Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Front and back side of late 16th-century brown leather binding with Caritas blocks and decorative rolls in gold Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Front and back side of late 16th-century (1590-1600) brown leather binding with Caritas blocks and decorative rolls in gold Brown leather binding with Caritas blocks and decorative rolls in gold Circa {{Size|mm|158|116}} (per side) Late 16th century (1590-1600) Not known

Description of the entire manuscript in the catalogue of the KB: http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 (in Dutch) Koninklijke Bibliotheek {{PD-art|PD-old-70-1923}} [https://galerij.kb.nl/kb.html#/en/bout/page/16/zoom/3/lat/-70.17020068549206/lng/-118.30078125 Browse this manuscript] on the website of the KB. {{Koninklijke Bibliotheek}} 002_000v-001r Calendar for the month of January - Folio 1r https://www.kb.nl/kbhtml/bout/002_000v-001r.jpg Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Calendar for the month of January - Folio 1r Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Calendar for the month of January - Folio 1r Manuscript with illuminations on parchment, littera textualis Folia: {{Size|mm|158|116}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|101|64}}, 1 column, 24 lines Acquired by the KB from the antiquarian bookshop of Jörn Günther in Hamburg, Germany in 2007. For earlier provenance information see the [http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 KB catalogue] Illuminators: [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Gijsbrecht_van_Brederode|Masters of Gijsbrecht van Brederode]], Masters of the Haarlem Bible, [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Otto_van_Moerdrecht|Masters of Otto van Moerdrecht]] (circa 1420 - circa 1460), unknown Utrecht miniaturist 1453 [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/haarlem Haarlem], [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/utrecht Utrecht]

{{Koninklijke Bibliotheek}} 014_012v-013r The right folio (13r) show a computational table for calculating the day of Easter. It begins with the year 1453 (CCCC ende liii). We can therefore assume that the manuscript was made in 1453 https://www.kb.nl/kbhtml/bout/014_012v-013r.jpg Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Computational table for calculating the day of Easter (right folio 13r) Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Computational table for calculating the day of Easter (right folio 13r) Manuscript with illuminations on parchment, littera textualis Folia: {{Size|mm|158|116}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|101|64}}, 1 column, 24 lines Acquired by the KB from the antiquarian bookshop of Jörn Günther in Hamburg, Germany in 2007. For earlier provenance information see the [http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 KB catalogue] Illuminators: [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Gijsbrecht_van_Brederode|Masters of Gijsbrecht van Brederode]], Masters of the Haarlem Bible, [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Otto_van_Moerdrecht|Masters of Otto van Moerdrecht]] (circa 1420 - circa 1460), unknown Utrecht miniaturist 1453 [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/haarlem Haarlem], [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/utrecht Utrecht]

{{Koninklijke Bibliotheek}} 015_015v-016r Computational tables for calculating the day of Easter (folios 15v and 16r) https://www.kb.nl/kbhtml/bout/015_015v-016r.jpg Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Computational tables for calculating the day of Easter (folios 15v and 16r) Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Computational tables for calculating the day of Easter (folios 15v and 16r) Manuscript with illuminations on parchment, littera textualis Folia: {{Size|mm|158|116}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|101|64}}, 1 column, 24 lines Acquired by the KB from the antiquarian bookshop of Jörn Günther in Hamburg, Germany in 2007. For earlier provenance information see the [http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 KB catalogue] Illuminators: [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Gijsbrecht_van_Brederode|Masters of Gijsbrecht van Brederode]], Masters of the Haarlem Bible, [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Otto_van_Moerdrecht|Masters of Otto van Moerdrecht]] (circa 1420 - circa 1460), unknown Utrecht miniaturist 1453 [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/haarlem Haarlem], [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/utrecht Utrecht]

Description of the entire manuscript in the catalogue of the KB: http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 (in Dutch) Koninklijke Bibliotheek {{PD-art|PD-old-70-1923}} [https://galerij.kb.nl/kb.html#/en/bout/page/16/zoom/3/lat/-70.17020068549206/lng/-118.30078125 Browse this manuscript] on the website of the KB. Or read [https://www.kb.nl/themas/middeleeuwen/bout-psalter-getijdenboek backgroud information in Dutch] and in [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours English]
{{Koninklijke Bibliotheek}} 016_016v-017r The left folio (16v) shows a [[:w:en:Phlebotomy|phlebotomy]] table, where we learn that the constellation Gemini is responsible for shoulders, arms, and hands. Gemini must lie correctly in the sky before bloodletting is performed to cure these body parts. On the bottom right on folio 17r: the [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/amsterdam coat of arms of the Bout family] (three arrows) which has been overpainted; see the front on folio 17v https://www.kb.nl/kbhtml/bout/016_016v-017r.jpg Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - Folio 016v - Phlebotomy table (left) and 017r (right) Bout Psalter-Hours - KB 79 K 11 - [[:w:en:Phlebotomy|phlebotomy]] table (left) and coat of arms of the Bout family (three arrows, bottom right) Manuscript with illuminations on parchment, littera textualis Folia: {{Size|mm|158|116}}; Text block: {{Size|mm|101|64}}, 1 column, 24 lines Illuminators: [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Gijsbrecht_van_Brederode|Masters of Gijsbrecht van Brederode]], Masters of the Haarlem Bible, [[:w:nl:Meester_van_Otto_van_Moerdrecht|Masters of Otto van Moerdrecht]] (circa 1420 - circa 1460), unknown Utrecht miniaturist 1453 [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/haarlem Haarlem], [https://www.kb.nl/en/themes/middle-ages/bout-psalter-hours/utrecht Utrecht] Acquired by the KB from the antiquarian bookshop of Jörn Günther in Hamburg, Germany in 2007. For earlier provenance information see the [http://opc4.kb.nl/PPN?PPN=311783821 KB catalogue]
